title: Here's when the Redmi Note 14 series and the Xiaomi 15 will reach India
description: The Redmi Note 14 family made its debut in China in September, and ever since then you may have been wondering when the global launch will take place. Today we have the answer, sort of. What's clear is that the Redmi Note 14 devices are launching in India in December. This comes directly from the company. What's less clear is if that will be the global launch, or only one for the Indian market. We assume the former, but can't be sure just yet. Interestingly, this means India will have gotten two Redmi Note generations this year, as the Redmi Note 13 devices also launched in 2024....
excerpt: The word comes straight from Xiaomi India execs, so it's as official as can be. The Redmi Note 14 family made its debut in China in September, and ever...
text: The Redmi Note 14 family made its debut in China in September, and ever since then you may have been wondering when the global launch will take place. Today we have the answer, sort of. What's clear is that the Redmi Note 14 devices are launching in India in December. This comes directly from the company. What's less clear is if that will be the global launch, or only one for the Indian market. We assume the former, but can't be sure just yet. Interestingly, this means India will have gotten two Redmi Note generations this year, as the Redmi Note 13 devices also launched in 2024. That isn't going to be a fluke, as Indian execs have revealed that this line will continue to get updates twice each year, which used to be the case before the COVID-19 pandemic. Then it got slowed to once a year, but now things are back in full swing with "improved efficiency and manufacturing alignment". The Xiaomi 15 will reach India in March, and the Redmi A4 will get a full launch later this month as a very cheap 5G smartphone. Source
html:
The Redmi Note 14 family made its debut in China in September, and ever since then you may have been wondering when the global launch will take place. Today we have the answer, sort of.

What's clear is that the Redmi Note 14 devices are launching in India in December. This comes directly from the company. What's less clear is if that will be the global launch, or only one for the Indian market. We assume the former, but can't be sure just yet.

Interestingly, this means India will have gotten two Redmi Note generations this year, as the Redmi Note 13 devices also launched in 2024. That isn't going to be a fluke, as Indian execs have revealed that this line will continue to get updates twice each year, which used to be the case before the COVID-19 pandemic. Then it got slowed to once a year, but now things are back in full swing with "improved efficiency and manufacturing alignment".

The Xiaomi 15 will reach India in March, and the Redmi A4 will get a full launch later this month as a very cheap 5G smartphone.

Source
